Publications on International Relations

In addition to my work as a product developer, I'm an active writer on international relations and US foreign policy. My work appears in a number of influential online news outlets and is often referenced in US military and government publications.


Below are selected works from my time at the Council on Foreign Relations in New York City.


CFR Backgrounder: Twenty Agendas at G-20, Part II

Publisher: Council on Foreign Relations

Leaders attending the 2009 Group of 20 summit in Pittsburgh will seek to forge agreements to buoy a global economic recovery and repair financial imbalances that contributed to the recession. (By Jamal Afridi)

Read Full

CFR Backgrounder: China-Pakistan Relations

Publisher: Council on Foreign Relations

As the United States and India cement their warmest relationship ever, India’s rival, Pakistan, is broadening ties with its own powerful ally: China. (By Jamal Afridi)

Read Full

CFR Interactive: U.S. War in Afghanistan Timeline

Publisher: Council on Foreign Relations

An in-depth timeline on the U.S. War in Afghanistan. (Additional Research and Writing: Jamal Afridi)

Read Full

CFR Backgrounder: Kashmir Militant Extremists

Publisher: Council on Foreign Relations

A profile of militant extremist groups in the disputed Himalayan region of Kashmir. (By Jamal Afridi)

Read Full

CFR Backgrounder: Presidential Power in Iran

Publisher: Council on Foreign Relations

Iran's Supreme Leader remains the regime's ultimate authority but the spirited campaign for the country's June 12 presidential election has raised new interest in the role and power of the head of state. (By Greg Bruno and Jamal Afridi)
